text.section:
The administration of pertussis vaccine to an individual may not be required by any provision of law if, in the physician's medical judgment:
The circumstances specified under subsection (a)(1) or (2) of this section are present; or
Taking into account the information specified under subsection (a)(3) of this section as well as all other relevant information, and the risk to the potential recipient outweighs the benefits both to the potential recipient and to the public in administering the vaccine.
Nothing in this section shall be construed to affect any emergency authority of the Secretary under any other provision of law to protect the public health.
